etymologies: late 19th century: from modern Latin Characinus (genus name), from Greek kharax, literally ‘pointed stake’, denoting a kind of fish

definitions: a small and brightly colored freshwater fish native to Africa and tropical America.

notes.text: Family Characidae: numerous species, including the piranhas and popular aquarium fishes such as the tetras

shortDefinitions: small and brightly coloured freshwater fish native to Africa
